description.narrative: The Solidarity Center assists the GFBTU as it convenes strategic planning meetings with Bahrain-based migrant workers. This is done in conjunction with assistance to the Federation for the development of migrant worker education materials in multiple languages. These materials aid migrants in understanding their rights under national and international law and allow the GFBTU to outline assistance it can provide to migrant worker communities. Ongoing technical support and guidance are also provided to the GFBTU as they engage in trade union and worker advocacy under the project.

The Solidarity Center partners with the General Federation of Bahrain Trade Unions (GFBTU) to enhance its capacity to reach out to migrant workers and to campaign for worker rights, including freedom of association and freedom of expression. About half of Bahrain’s workforce migrated to the country for jobs, primarily from Asia.
